title: Spaghetti Carbonara
summary: A classic Italian pasta dish with eggs, cheese, bacon, and black pepper.
steps: Cook the spaghetti according to package instructions.
Fry the bacon until crispy.
Beat the eggs and mix with Parmesan cheese.
Combine the hot spaghetti with the bacon, then mix in the egg mixture.
Season with black pepper and serve.

title: Chicken Tikka Masala
summary: Chunks of grilled chicken (tikka) cooked in a smooth buttery & creamy tomato-based gravy.
steps: Marinate chicken in yogurt and spices.
Grill the chicken until cooked through.
Prepare the gravy with tomato sauce, cream, and additional spices.
Combine the grilled chicken with the gravy and simmer.
Serve with rice or naan.

title: Beef Stroganoff
summary: A Russian dish of sautéed pieces of beef served in a sauce with smetana (sour cream).
steps: Sauté onions and mushrooms until tender.
Add beef and cook until browned.
Stir in flour and cook for a minute.
Add beef broth and bring to a simmer.
Mix in sour cream and cook until thickened.
Serve over noodles or rice.

title: Caesar Salad
summary: A green salad of romaine lettuce and croutons dressed with lemon juice, olive oil, egg, Worcestershire sauce, garlic, and Parmesan cheese.
steps: Tear the romaine lettuce into bite-sized pieces.
Prepare the Caesar dressing with lemon juice, olive oil, egg, Worcestershire sauce, garlic, and Parmesan cheese.
Toss the lettuce with the dressing.
Top with croutons and additional Parmesan cheese.

title: Margarita Pizza
summary: A simple pizza made with tomatoes, mozzarella cheese, fresh basil, salt, and olive oil.
steps: Preheat the oven to 475°F (245°C).
Spread tomato sauce over the pizza dough.
Top with mozzarella cheese.
Bake until the crust is golden and the cheese is melted.
Top with fresh basil and drizzle with olive oil.

title: Shrimp Scampi
summary: A classic Italian dish featuring shrimp cooked in a garlic butter and white wine sauce, served over pasta.
instructions: 1 pound large shrimp, peeled and deveined
steps: Cook the pasta according to package instructions, then drain and set aside.
In a large skillet, heat olive oil and 2 tablespoons of butter over medium heat.
Add minced garlic and cook for about 1 minute until fragrant.
Add the shrimp to the skillet, cooking for 2-3 minutes on each side until they are pink and opaque. Remove shrimp from the skillet and set aside.
In the same skillet, pour in white wine, lemon juice, and red pepper flakes. Bring to a simmer and cook for 2-3 minutes.
Add the remaining 1 tablespoon of butter to the skillet, stirring until melted and combined with the sauce.
Return the cooked shrimp to the skillet and toss to coat in the sauce.
Add the cooked pasta to the skillet, tossing everything together until well combined and heated through.
Season with salt and black pepper to taste.
Garnish with chopped fresh parsley and optional grated Parmesan cheese before serving.
